meanings.definition: The process of reproducing images by photography.
meanings.sent1: Autotypy is a way to make copies of pictures using a camera.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often use autotypy to duplicate their images for printing.
meanings.sent3: I tried to use autotypy to copy my drawing, but the camera was not cooperating.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like autotypy, capturing every detail of the scene with precision.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of autotypy lies in its ability to faithfully replicate the original image.

meanings.definition: A photographic process for making printing plates.
meanings.sent1: Autotypy is a method to create plates for printing from photographs.
meanings.sent2: The printing industry relies on autotypy to produce high-quality plates efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat accidentally stepped on the autotypy machine, creating a unique plate.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like an autotypy machine, converting memories into tangible prints.
meanings.sent5: The autotypy process revolutionized the way printing plates were made, saving time and resources.
